name: Sto'Vo'Kor Lost
description: All Klingons look forward to an afterlife of eternal, glorious battle in Sto'Vo'Kor. But what if they never die? Immortality is sweeping the Empire! Can you find out what's causing it?
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of L'Rell, Worf, Q Junior, or members of the Q Continuum, or matching a Battle Trait will provide a bonus.
-- Using the IKS Negh'Var, the U.S.S. Defiant, or the Bird of Prey will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: L'Rell, Worf, Q Junior, or members of the Q Continuum

rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

next_threshold_rewards.name: Credits
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

screens.text: "Every Klingon welcomes death, for it is the day we enter Sto'Vo'Kor, and an eternity of glorious battle. That is, if we die. We have received reports that Klingons are surviving injuries and illness that should kill them. That they are, in effect... immortal."
"Battling alive, battling dead... I don't really see the difference, to be honest. Sounds like this way, you can have your bat'leth and swing it, too."

"Do not speak of what you do not understand, boy. An empire of immortal warriors will not fight amongst themselves for glory. They will seek out their enemies, or make new ones. Much as I long to see my people ascend, we need allies, too."

"Well, then. Sounds like you could use the help of someone who knows a little something about immortality--even if he is a boy. Oh, and you might want to do something about all the Klingon warships headed out to pick fights, too."
"The Empire is officially disavowing the actions of those warriors attacking our allies, but incursions continue to mount. We cannot play this foolish game any longer."
"You and your father are tI'qa' of the same stripe. Admit to what you have done, before I wring it from you myself!"

responses.text: "Why would you do such a thing?"

screens.text: "All right! I may have dabbled in giving a few Klingons immortality. And by a few, I mean all of them."
"I was curious! Death, we don't have anything like it in the Continuum. You mortals are so strange and interesting."
"Not another step, or I'll turn you all into amoebas!"
"I would just snap them back if I could, but I can't. I am a boy, I suppose. Still learning my powers. I can make you immortal just fine, but I can't seem to go the other way."
"Please, don't tell my father. I promise I will find a way to fix this. I just need more time. Keep the Klingons busy, will you?"
